Utica.Soldiers and Sailors Monument (Syracuse,:
Soldiers and Sailors Monument (1908-11) is a Beaux Arts monument in Syracuse, New York, dedicated to the 12,265 men of Onondaga County who served in the Civil War. It was designed by architect Clarence Blackall, with bronze sculpture by Cyrus Dallin, and was erected in Clinton Square, alongside the Erie Canal.
The monument consists of a square granite pylon with attached Roman Ionic columns at its corners, supporting a heavy cornice with a carved frieze, and crowned by a globe guarded by four eagles grasping a thick garland.
